field.label: Enable SSLH
field.help: This will enable the SSLH service.

field.label: Listen Addresses
field.help: Hostname (or IP address) and port combination on which to listen, e.g. localhost:443, 10.5.0.1:443 (typically these resolve to-, or specify, a WAN IP address). This can be defined multiple times to bind sslh to several addresses.

field.label: Mode
field.help: Select the mode in which to run sslh: fork - stable but slow performance | select - new but high performance

field.label: Timeout
field.help: Timeout in seconds before forwarding the connection to the timeout protocol (which should usually be SSH). Default: 2

field.label: On Timeout
field.help: Name of the protocol to connect to after the timeout period is over. Default is to forward to the first specified protocol. It usually makes sense to specify 'ssh' as the timeout protocol, as the SSH specification does not tell who is supposed to speak first and a large number of SSH clients wait for the server to send its banner. Default: ssh

field.label: SSH Target
field.help: Interface and port on which to forward SSH connections, typically localhost:22.

field.label: SSL/TLS Target
field.help: Interface and port on which to forward SSL connection, typically localhost:443. Note that you can set sslh to listen on ext_ip:443 and httpd to listen on localhost:443: this allows clients inside your network to just connect directly to httpd. Also, sslh probes for SSLv3 (or TLSv1) handshake and will reject connections from clients requesting SSLv2. This is compliant with RFC6176 which prohibits the usage of SSLv2. If you wish to accept SSLv2, use --anyprot instead.

field.label: OpenVPN Target
field.help: Interface and port on which to forward OpenVPN connections, typically localhost:1194.

field.label: HTTP Target
field.help: Interface and port on which to forward HTTP connections, typically localhost:80.

field.label: XMPP Target
field.help: Interface and port on which to forward XMPP connections, typically localhost:5222.

field.label: Tinc Target
field.help: Interface and port on which to forward Tinc connections, typically localhost:655.

field.label: Anyprot Target
field.help: Interface and port on which to forward if no other protocol has been found. Because sslh tries protocols in the order specified on the command line, this should be specified last. If no default is specified, sslh will forward unknown protocols to the first protocol specified.

field.label: Numeric
field.help: Do not attempt to resolve hostnames: logs will contain IP addresses. This is mostly useful if the system's DNS is slow and running the sslh-select variant, as DNS requests will hang all connections. Default: false
